Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
taskman - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: TaskMan Input File
Screen.Label: Task Manager parameter file for control of project tasks
EXEC_MODE=

Help.Tip: Name of project file.
Help.Text:
taskman - SELECT_PATH_PRJ
Name of project file.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Name of the project file which has information relevant to
 all jobs in a project. Parameters in the project file are displayed
 on the TaskMan Parameters tab.

Help.Tip: Name of project file.
Help.Text:
taskman - PATH_PRJ
Name of project file.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Name of the project file which has information relevant to
 all jobs in a project. Parameters in the project file are displayed
 on the TaskMan Parameters tab.

Help.Tip: Press button to read the PATH_PRJ file.
Help.Text:
taskman - READ_IT
Press button to read the PATH_PRJ file.
 
 When the READ_IT button is pressed TASKMAN
 will read the PATH_PRJ file and update the display.

Help.Tip: Press button to write the PATH_PRJ file.
Help.Text:
taskman - WRITE_IT
Press button to write the PATH_PRJ file.
 
 When the WRITE_IT button is pressed TASKMAN
 will write the PATH_PRJ file.

Help.Tip: Choose how taskman behaves in the main program.
Help.Text:
taskman - EXEC_MODE
Choose how taskman behaves in the main program.
 
 Default = SETUP
 Allowed = SETUP
 Allowed = EXECUTE
 SETUP makes taskman a setup only process.
 EXECUTE makes taskman be called at setup and at
 trace execution time.

Help.Tip: Name of an FXINFO list file.
Help.Text:
taskman - SELECT_LSTFILE
Name of an FXINFO list file.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 The FXINFO list file contains an array of FXINFO file
 names. Same format used by FXPROJECT.

Help.Tip: Name of an FXINFO list file.
Help.Text:
taskman - LSTFILE
Name of an FXINFO list file.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 The FXINFO list file contains an array of FXINFO file
 names. Same format used by FXPROJECT. The shots described in the
 fxinfo files become the tasks when TSKTYPE=SHOT_LST

Help.Tip: Number of FXINFO files pointed to by LSTFILE.
Help.Text:
taskman - NINFO
Number of FXINFO files pointed to by LSTFILE.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = > 1
 Number of FXINFO files pointed to by LSTFILE.

Help.Tip: Number of shots described by the fxinfo files.
Help.Text:
taskman - NSHOTS
Number of shots described by the fxinfo files.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = > 1
 Number of shots described by the fxinfo files.

Help.Tip: Full path name of a CPS job script.
Help.Text:
taskman - JOBFILE
Full path name of a CPS job script.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Name of a cps job file. When TSKTYPE=SHOT_LST or SHOT_SKP, this script
 will be executed to perform the shot tasks. The script must include the
 FXSHOT process set up for internal IO. When TSKTYPE=JOB, the JOBFILE
 is a template to generate the names of other CPS jobs that will
 be run. It is assumed the MWB has generated job names with the
 skip pattern specified in the project file.

Help.Tip: Future Use-Full path name of file for stacking images.
Help.Text:
taskman - STKFILE
Future Use-Full path name of file for stacking images.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Full path name file to be used for stacking images.

Help.Tip: Name of task list file.
Help.Text:
taskman - TSKFILE
Name of task list file.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Name of the task list file which has information
 about the tasks that are to be performed by cps jobs. The
 TSKFILE is written when the WRITE_TSKFILE button is pressed.

Help.Tip: Type of tasks to generate and process.
Help.Text:
taskman - TSKTYPE
Type of tasks to generate and process.
 
 Default = SHOT_SKP
 Allowed = JOB  Tasks will be interpreted as CPS jobs.
 Allowed = SHOT_SKP Tasks are interpreted as a skip pattern of shot indices
 Allowed = SHOT_LST Tasks are taken as shots numbers from the lstfile.
 The skip pattern is honored for all options, but may be clipped in
 the case of SHOT_LST due to data limitations.

Help.Tip: Upper limit on the number of tasks to execute and monitor.
Help.Text:
taskman - TASK_TOT
Upper limit on the number of tasks to execute and monitor.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = > 1
 Upper limit on the number of tasks to execute and monitor.
 Used for task generation.

Help.Tip: Initial skip in the task pattern.
Help.Text:
taskman - TASK_ISKP
Initial skip in the task pattern.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = > -1
 Set up a task index pattern with this initial skip.

Help.Tip: Group size in the task skip pattern.
Help.Text:
taskman - TASK_NDO
Group size in the task skip pattern.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = > 0
 Set up a task index pattern with group size=ndo.

Help.Tip: Skips between groups in the task pattern.
Help.Text:
taskman - TASK_SKP
Skips between groups in the task pattern.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = > -1
 Set up a task index pattern with this skip between groups of ndo.

Help.Tip: Press button to write or rewrite TSKFILE.
Help.Text:
taskman - WRITE_TSKFILE
Press button to write or rewrite TSKFILE.
 
 When the WRITE_TSKFILE button is pressed TASKMAN
 will write TSKFILE. If RESTART=YES the entire task file will
 be rewritten. When RESTART=NO, only the non-task portion of
 the task file will be updated. This allows one to preserve the
 status of the tasks when a project is partially complete.

Help.Tip: Controls how much of TSKFILE is written.
Help.Text:
taskman - RESTART
Controls how much of TSKFILE is written.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = NO
 Allowed = YES
 Set to YES to completely write or rewrite the task list file.
 Set to NO to preserve the status of existing tasks in a project
 that is already in progress. CAUTION - you can loose your completed
 work if you overwrite the task list when RESTART=YES. Typically
 the task file is written 1 time with restart = YES. There after
 one would normally rewrite it with restart=NO.

Help.Tip: Whether to halt at the end of the current task or not.
Help.Text:
taskman - JOB_HALT
Whether to halt at the end of the current task or not.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = NO
 Allowed = YES
  If YES then a job will halt at the end of the current task.
  If NO  then a job will continue its normal processing.
  This parameter is saved in the TSKFILE and will not be updated
  until TSKFILE is written. To preserve task status for an ongoing
  project, set restart=NO when updating job_halt in the TSKFILE.

Help.Tip: Controls auto-submission of jobs.
Help.Text:
taskman - JOB_START
Controls auto-submission of jobs.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = NO
 Allowed = YES
  If YES then a new job will be started when a job ends and there is
  still work to be done. If NO then no jobs will be started when
  an old job ends. The serv_host variable needs to be set if
  job_start=YES. The serv_host name is will be used in an rsh command
  to start the next batch job.

Help.Tip: Maximum number of CPUS that your project can use.
Help.Text:
taskman - PRJ_CPUS
Maximum number of CPUS that your project can use.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = > 0
 Maximum number of cpus allowed for the project.

Help.Tip: Largest number of CPUS that 1 job will use.
Help.Text:
taskman - JOB_CPUS
Largest number of CPUS that 1 job will use.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = > 0
 Largest number of CPUS that 1 job will use.

Help.Tip: Make fields sensitive or not.
Help.Text:
taskman - EDIT
Make fields sensitive or not.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES
 Allowed = NO
 Allow or disallow editing of the task manager parameters

Help.Tip: Press button to plot the source locations.
Help.Text:
taskman - PLOT_SRC_XY
Press button to plot the source locations.
 
 The fxinfo file will be read and the source X-Y locations will
 be plotted in a gnuplot display

Help.Tip: Temp file to hold data for gnuplot.
Help.Text:
taskman - PLOT_FILE1
Temp file to hold data for gnuplot.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Temp file to hold data for gnuplot.

Help.Tip: Press button to plot the task statuses in TSKFILE.
Help.Text:
taskman - PLOT_TASKS
Press button to plot the task statuses in TSKFILE.
 
 The tskfile file will be read and the task status will
 be plotted in a gnuplot display

Help.Tip: Temp file to hold data for gnuplot.
Help.Text:
taskman - PLOT_FILE2
Temp file to hold data for gnuplot.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Temp file to hold data for gnuplot.

Screen.title: TaskMan Server
Screen.Label: Task Manager parameters controlling optional server mode
SERV_USE=
SERV_HOST=
SERV_PORT=

Help.Tip: Skips between groups in the task pattern.
Help.Text:
taskman - SERV_USE
Skips between groups in the task pattern.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES
 Allowed = NO
 Use server or server less mode.

Help.Tip: Host running server when SERV_USE=YES.
Help.Text:
taskman - SERV_HOST
Host running server when SERV_USE=YES.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = CHARACTER
 Host running server when SERV_USE=YES.

Help.Tip: Port number to use when SERV_USE=YES.
Help.Text:
taskman - SERV_PORT
Port number to use when SERV_USE=YES.
 
 Default = 2077
 Allowed = > 1024
 Port number to use when SERV_USE=YES.

Help.Tip: Press button to start the project server.
Help.Text:
taskman - SERV_START
Press button to start the project server.
 
 When the SERV_START button is pressed TASKMAN
 will start a server on host SERV_HOST that uses port number
 SERV_PORT. TASKMAN will only allow one instance of a server
 for a particular port, host and path_prj setting.

Help.Tip: Press button to stop the project server.
Help.Text:
taskman - SERV_STOP
Press button to stop the project server.
 
 When the SERV_STOP button is pressed TASKMAN
 will stop the server that is running on host SERV_HOST
 that uses port number SERV_PORT.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
taskman - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
taskman - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
taskman - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
taskman - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
taskman - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
taskman - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
taskman - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
taskman - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
taskman - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
taskman - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
taskman - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : TASKMAN
 Category   : miscellaneous
 Written    : 2002-07-11   by: dayrs
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Help control the execution of tasks in CPS
 Portability: No limitations
 Parallel   : Yes
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 TASKMAN or Task Manager is used to control task work. The
 task manager is used to help monitor and control the work done on a
 list of tasks that are associated with a project.
 
 TASKMAN takes parameters from a project file and maintains project
 status in a task list file. Only 1 instance of TASKMAN should occur in a job
 and it should be included after JOB_DATA.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 --> Insert advice to the user.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
012. 2006-10-16  D. Glover  Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
 11. 2005-08-18  R.S.Day    Delete unued variables.
 10. 2004-09-28  R.S.Day    Added taskman_wr_prjdata, taskman_get_jth_info,
                            taskman_wr_tskfile.
  9. 2004-09-14  R.S.Day    Promoted to beta. Added taskman_info_names_c.
  8. 2004-08-12  RSDay      Eliminate taskman_rd_info. Use fxcard fxdata.
  7. 2004-02-05  RSDay      More checks on serv_host and job_start parameters
                            Fix wrapup behavior when a signal has occured
  6. 2004-01-23  RSDay      Made change for fxpar_create compatability
  5. 2003-10-16  RSDay      Get rid of hard wired paths
  4. 2002-09-23  RSDay      Changes for taskman server mode support.
                            Changes forced by fxinfo and fxdata changes.
  3. 2002-08-15  RSDay      Added gnuplot plotting capability.
                            taskman_plot_data calls gpi functions.
                            Streamlined taskman_get_task
  2. 2002-08-09  RSDay      Added JOB_HALT and JOB_START parameters to GUI.
                            Change in arguments to taskman_prjfile_rd,
                            taskman_prjfile_wr and taskman_cl_init. Now
                            using fxinfo_read to get info from an fxinfo file.
  1. 2002-07-11  RSDay      Initial version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
